titles.title: Nurarihyon no Mago
Внук Нурарихёна
حفيد نوراريهيون
Внукът на Нурарихьон
妖怪少爺
نورا: به پا خواستن قبیله شیاطین
NuraMago
ぬらりひょんの孫
Nura: Rise of the Yokai Clan
Le seigneur des yôkai
Nurarihjonův vnuk
滑头鬼之孙

relatedanime.anime: Nurarihyon no Mago: Gekitou Dai Futsal Taikai! Nuragumi W Cup!!

recommendations.recommendation: Slow story, shounen clichés. Don`t expect good animation either, the fights are basically made up of still pictures. Might still be enjoyable for big shounen fans and youkai fanatics, but it`s not really a good show.
The first season is quite watchable, but if you watch 1st season, then second one you`ll get in love with this anime!

anime.description: * Based on http://anidb.net/cr20100 [Shiibashi Hiroshi]`s Nurarihyon no Mago shounen manga. In the story, http://anidb.net/ch15458 [Nura Rikuo], a kid who is part human and a quarter youkai (http://anidb.net/t2646 [demon]), lives in a house full of spirits along with http://anidb.net/ch17493 [his grandfather]. Trying to escape his fate of acting like a demon, he does good deeds in order to avoid becoming one — despite his grandfather`s wish to succeed him as master of the http://anidb.net/ch37514 [Nurari youkai clan].

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: onmyoudou
tag.description: Onmyoudou (also in`youdou, lit. "The Way of Yin and Yang") is a traditional Japanese esoteric cosmology that mixes natural science and occultism. A practitioner of onmyoudou is called an onmyouji. Onmyoudou is based on the Chinese philosophies of Wu Xing (five elements) and yin and yang, introduced into Japan at the beginning of the 6th century and accepted as a practical system of divination. These practices were further influenced by Taoism, Buddhism and Shintoism, evolving into the system of onmyoudou around the late 7th century. Onmyoudou was under the control of the imperial government, and later of the Tsuchimikado family of courtiers, until the middle of the 19th century, at which point it became prohibited as superstition. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: bishounen
tag.description: Young man whose beauty (and sexual appeal) transcends the boundary of gender or sexual orientation.

tag.name: multiple personality disorder
tag.description: Multiple personality disorder is a psychiatric diagnosis that describes a condition in which a single person displays multiple distinct identities or personalities (known as alter egos or alters), each with its own pattern of perceiving and interacting with the environment.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: fetishes
tag.description: Everything under fetishes (except for Bishounen and Juujin) is strictly only meant for hentai (18 Restricted) and ecchi anime. In case of ecchi, it must be the main element of the show and not when there`s only some of it, for example, there`s some ecchi in Shinseiki Evangelion, but the fact you get to see Asuka`s pantsu doesn`t warrant it the schoolgirl fetish category. So be careful to which ecchi show you add fetishes; it`s fairly straightforward with hentai, though. Overall, this category tree is to satisfy the needs of people with different fetishes, so they can search for what tingles their tangle; hence why this is restricted to hentai and full ecchi shows.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: swordplay
tag.description: The act or art of using a sword or similar weapon skillfully.

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: demon
tag.description: In Western lore, demons are often described as minions from Hell, generally known to attack humans and feast on their flesh or possess the bodies of those with weak souls. In Eastern lore, on the other hand, they are generally supernatural, often but not always malevolent beings who can be more mischievous than actually evil, or simply supernatural spirits of no specific alignment.

tag.name: contemporary fantasy
tag.description: Contemporary fantasy, also known as modern fantasy or indigenous fantasy, is a sub-genre of fantasy, set in the present day. It is perhaps most popular for its sub-genre, urban fantasy. These terms are used to describe stories set in the putative real world (often referred to as consensus reality) in contemporary times, in which magic and magical creatures exist, either living in the interstices of our world or leaking over from alternate worlds. It thus has much in common with, and sometimes overlaps with secret history; a work of fantasy in which the magic could not remain secret or does not have any known relationship to known history would not fit into this subgenre. Occasionally certain contemporary fantasy novels will make reference to pop culture. Novels in which modern characters travel into alternate worlds, and all the magical action takes place there (except for the portal required to transport them), are not considered contemporary fantasy. Thus, C.S. Lewis`s The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe, where all fantasy events take place in the land of Narnia which is reached via a magic wardrobe, would not count as contemporary fantasy; on the other hand, the part of The Magician`s Nephew, where the Empress Jadis gets to London, tries to take over the Earth and clashes with police and a crowd of cockneys, would qualify as such. Contemporary fantasy is also to be distinguished from horror fiction, which also often has contemporary settings. When encountering magical events and creatures, the protagonist of a horror novel is horrified, while the protagonist of a fantasy novel (contemporary or otherwise) is filled with a sense of joy and wonder. Horrifying events may happen, but the fundamental distinction is vital. In his preface to That Hideous Strength, one of the earlier works falling within this sub-genre, C.S. Lewis explained why, when writing a tale about "magicians, devils, pantomime animals and planetary angels", he chose to start it with a detailed depiction of narrow-minded academic politics at a provincial English university and the schemes of crooked real estate developers: "I am following the traditional fairy-tale. We do not always notice its method, because the cottages, castles, woodcutters and petty kings with which a fairy tale opens have become for us as remote as the witches and ogres to which it proceeds. But they were not remote at all to the men who first made and enjoyed the tales". The same is true for many of the later works in the genre, which often begin with a seemingly normal scene of modern daily life to then disclose supernatural and magical beings and events hidden behind the scenes. Source: wiki

tag.name: school clubs
tag.description: Even though school clubs in Japan are not mandatory, there is some pressure from the social grid (e.g. fellow students, teachers) to participate in some kind of after-school activity, be it in sports or arts. Colleges also have clubs. As a comedy element in anime, some students have joined too many clubs, and are thus constantly stressed out. There is also the element of social commentary, making it clear that you have to join a club, if you want to be part of the class. Since self-founded clubs need at least 3 members, the desperate search and advertising for new members can be cause for hilarity in anime.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: fantasy
tag.description: Fantasy is a genre of fiction that uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting. Many works within the genre take place in fictional worlds where magic is common. Fantasy is generally distinguished from science fiction and horror by the expectation that it steers clear of (pseudo-)scientific and macabre themes, respectively, though there is a great deal of overlap between the three (which are subgenres of speculative fiction). In popular culture, the genre of fantasy is dominated by its medievalist form, especially since the worldwide success of The Lord of the Rings books by J. R. R. Tolkien. In its broadest sense however, fantasy comprises works by many writers, artists, filmmakers, and musicians, from ancient myths and legends to many recent works embraced by a wide audience today. Fantasy is a vibrant area of academic study in a number of disciplines (English, cultural studies, comparative literature, history, medieval studies). Work in this area ranges widely, from the structuralist theory of Tzvetan Todorov, which emphasizes the fantastic as a liminal space, to work on the connections (political, historical, literary) between medievalism and popular culture Source: Wiki

tag.name: adventure
tag.description: Adventures are exciting stories, with new experiences or exotic locales. Adventures are designed to provide an action-filled, energetic experience for the viewer. Rather than the predominant emphasis on violence and fighting that is found in pure action anime, however, the viewer of adventures can live vicariously through the travels, conquests, explorations, creation of empires, struggles and situations that confront the main characters, actual historical figures or protagonists. Under the category of adventures, we can include traditional swashbucklers, serialized films, and historical spectacles, searches or expeditions for lost continents, "jungle" and "desert" epics, treasure hunts and quests, disaster films, and heroic journeys or searches for the unknown. Adventure films are often, but not always, set in an historical period, and may include adapted stories of historical or literary adventure heroes, kings, battles, rebellion, or piracy.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: friendship
tag.description: The feeling of trust, kindness, and friendship between a group of high school students for example, is a central theme of this anime.

tag.name: daily life
tag.description: The antics of the protagonists do not take place in some exotic setting or time, but in everyday life. When not "at the job" this means getting up in the morning, making meals, house cleaning, going shopping or out to eat, visiting the bath house or spa, leisure activities in the spare time, etc. The time "on the job" for students is School Life, for others working in their profession. Daily Life is basically a synonym for everything normal, repetitive, and trivial happening to your average person.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: alcohol
tag.description: Alcohol (or more scientifically, ethanol), is one of the world`s oldest psychoactive substances. It is traditionally found in the form of a beverage such as beer, wine, or liquor, although in some contexts it can be inhaled to produce similar or intoxication, and some people prefer another way of consuming beverage-form alcohol. Alcoholic beverages are many and varied, due to production methods (fermentation or distillation), source materials (grains, fruits, vegetables, other plants), added substances such as flavorings, and many more ways of defining different forms of alcoholic beverages. Alcoholic beverages are divided into three general classes: beers, wines, and spirits. They are legally consumed in most countries, and over 100 countries have laws regulating their production, sale, and consumption. In particular, such laws specify the minimum age at which a person may legally buy or drink them. This minimum age varies between 16 and 25 years, depending upon the country and the type of drink. Most nations set it at 18 years of age.

tag.name: coming of age
tag.description: In the strict sense the Coming of age describes a young person`s transition from adolescence to adulthood. In anime the term is used in a more general sense where the protagonists have to face a challenge, make an important decision in their life, take on responsibility, or learn a lesson, and by overcoming these obstacles they reach a higher level of maturity.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: skilled main character
tag.description: The main character in the show is very skilled in one or more tasks, often to the amazement of those around him/her.

tag.name: ohanami
tag.description: Hanami (花見, lit. "flower viewing") is the Japanese traditional custom of enjoying the beauty of flowers, "flower" in this case almost always meaning cherry blossoms or ume blossoms. From the end of March to early May, sakura bloom all over Japan, and around the first of February on the island of Okinawa. The blossom forecast (桜前線 sakurazensen, literally cherry blossom front) is announced each year by the weather bureau, and is watched carefully by those planning hanami as the blossoms only last a week or two. In modern-day Japan, hanami mostly consists of having an outdoor party beneath the sakura during daytime or at night. Hanami at night is called yozakura (夜桜, literally night sakura). (Source: Wikipedia)

tag.name: sake
tag.description: Sake, generally referred to as a Japanese rice wine, is an alcoholic beverage made by fermenting rice. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: mythology
tag.description: The anime gets inspirations from many forms of mythologies (either Greek, Egyptian, Nord, etc.) to form its story and setting.

tag.name: strong male lead
tag.description: The lead male protagonist in this anime shows backbone, is competent, and does not shy away from seemingly insurmountable objectives.

tag.name: Japanese mythology
tag.description: Japanese mythology is a system of beliefs that embraces Shinto and Buddhist traditions as well as agriculture-based folk religion. The Shinto pantheon alone consists of an uncountable number of kami (Japanese for "gods" or "spirits"). (Source: Wikipedia)

tag.name: hidden power
tag.description: For some reason or another a character has powers (or potential) he or she can`t access and may not even know about. In some anime these hidden powers are used quite frequently to overcome an enemy or threat (e.g. Naruto, Bleach).

tag.name: spirits
tag.description: Spirits will appear throughout this anime. These will often be depicted as small orbs of glowing light, or transparent images of the deceased. Not to be mistaken with "I see dead people", these spirits will usually appear at the location of their departure when the characters have gotten close to the truth surrounding their death. Or as plot element, when a spirit will often stay close to a character as a sort of "Guardian Angel". Although they are never actually seen, their presence is sometimes felt.

tag.name: Weekly Shounen Jump
tag.description: The Weekly Shounen Jump is a Japanese manga magazine released on a weekly basis. Its main target audience consists of young males and it features several manga titles. The magazine was created by http://anidb.net/cr780 [Shueisha] in July, 1968, and was originally only called Shounen Jump, because it was not published every week at the time. A number of very famous shounen manga were or are published in it, such as http://anidb.net/a386 [Hokuto no Ken], http://anidb.net/a231 [Dragon Ball], http://anidb.net/a942 [City Hunter], http://anidb.net/a826 [Saint Seiya], http://anidb.net/a590 [Slam Dunk], http://anidb.net/a312 [Yuu Yuu Hakushou], http://anidb.net/a69 [One Piece], http://anidb.net/a239 [Naruto], http://anidb.net/a2369 [Bleach], http://anidb.net/a4563 [Death Note], http://anidb.net/a3468 [Gintama], to name a few of the most well-known.

tag.name: secret identity
tag.description: The (usually main) protagonist has a secret identity that he or she desperately tries to keep secret. This can lead to all sorts of amusing misunderstandings, thus is used as comedy element in some anime.

tag.name: master-servant relationship
tag.description: To some genres, this would suggest a genuine pairing where one person exists to serve another person, such as in some action/dramas where the pair becomes united by destiny as partners — fighting or battles between different pairs/partners will usually be a dominant part of the story. In other genres, this suggests a relationship where one person may be occupied as or even forcefully treated as a servant or slave to the other who designates themself the master — these services usually apply anywhere from tsundere/romantic-comedies to ecchi or to the more extreme in hentai.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO EPISODE
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to episode tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what episodes they should be assigned to.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: character related tags which need deleting or merging
speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Nura Rikuo
character.description: Rikuo is the title character and main protagonist of the series, an average 12-year old boy who inherited 1/4 of his grandfather`s youkai blood. In times of impending danger his youkai blood awakens and he switches into his night form to become the Master of the youkai (the master of all spirits). His youkai form is confident, strong and inspires "Fear" amongst his allies leading many to join him. Rikuo is destined to take over as the Third Master of youkai from his grandfather, though the main conflict for the first portion of the series lies in his rejection of the idea. As a child, Rikuo respected and looked up to youkai, playing pranks on members of the Nura house and often declaring he would become more youkai-like and take over as the Third. However, after a discussion at school, he came to realize the evil nature of youkai deeds and decided to set himself firmly on the path of living a strictly human life. Since then, he has attempted to become more like a normal human by doing all sorts of good deeds. Even though he appreciates all that his youkai underlings do for him, he is nevertheless desperate to prevent his school friends from learning of his connection to youkai. After being tested by Gyuuki he decides to take the position of Young Head and saves both humans and youkai.

character.name: Ienaga Kana
character.description: Kana is Rikuo`s childhood friend and neighbor. She first appears in the original Nurarihyon no Mago one-shot as Yura Usami and says she hates things relating to youkai and spirit mediums. She is hinted to have some affection for Rikuo, as she gets jealous seeing Rikuo and Tsurara together. Rikuo made a promise to help her if she is ever in need. After being kidnapped by a youkai on her 13th birthday, she was saved by "Night" Rikuo and was taken to a youkai party. The next morning Kana asked Rikuo if he was friends with his youkai form and blushed when Rikuo asked why. She has fallen for Rikuo`s Night form. However, it is hinted that she is also starting to like Rikuo as she is much concerned and distracted when Tsurara gets too close to him.

character.name: Yukionna
character.description: Yukionna is Rikuo`s trusted attendant and part of Rikuo`s new "Hyakki Yakou" who follows him to school disguised as Tsurara Oikawa, a normal schoolgirl. She is affectionate towards Rikuo and even gets jealous when other girls pay him attention. This is also reinforced by the fact that other characters express how bad a situation would be come if Tsurara were to see what other female characters did to Rikuo. She also admires Rikuo`s youkai form, because she finds him very reliable and magnificent. She is overprotective of Rikuo when he is his "day" or human form and expresses great concern for his well being, which is the reason why she is always around him at school (which causes misunderstandings and concern on Kana`s part). She also acts as a cook and, though her food is delicious, most of the time it is chilled or cold. She also has a fear of Yura as she is an onmyouji and a rivalry with Kana (going so far as to nearly freeze her), however she protects as her death would sadden Rikuo. She is in Kyoto protecting the Investigation group along with Aotabou. Later, she rejoins Rikuo but is kidnapped by Tsuchigumo.

character.name: Nura Rikuo
character.description: His night (youkai) form is confident, strong and inspires "Fear" amongst his allies leading many to join him. He decides to leave the human side of things to his "Day" form and handle the youkai-side of things. After losing to his grandfather, he is taken to the youkai village to train and finally learns what type of demon he is and how to gain his Fear abilities. He has departed for Kyoto to face Hagoromo Gitsune to save Yura and avenge his father. He is currently undergoing a 3-day training with Gyuuki to surpass "Himself" after losing to Tsuchigumo. He seems to get stronger when his "Day" and "Night" blood mix. But now it seems as though night Rikuo and day Rikuo are one being and are not a split personality. His primary weapon is the Spirit Blade Nenekirimaru, which was designed to only harm youkai.

character.name: Nurarihyon
character.description: Nurarihyon is Rikuo`s grandfather, known as the master of all spirits or as the Supreme Commander. It is said that he plays pranks and hates humans, but he doesn`t really hate them - rather, he doesn`t believe humans should interfere in youkai affairs. He dislikes the fact that Rikuo goes to school and acts human but respects his wishes. 400 years ago, he fell in love with Youhime and fought with the Hagoromo-Gitsune in Kyoto. He won and became the master of all spirits but at the cost of shortening his life span greatly. In his prime, he and Keikan Hidemoto were considered friends. Even in his old age, he can easily best "Night" Rikuo and Muchi. Normal demons feel so much "Fear" that he is invisible to them until he strikes, that is his "Meikyou Shisui".

character.name: Zen
character.description: A Poisonous bird Youkai who was a childhood friend of Rikuo, he was disappointed the Rikuo had become so soft. His species has short lifespan and as a result he has become very weak, but he specializes in making medicine. After being betrayed and nearly killed he was rescued by "Night" Rikuo, he continues to support Rikuo and is the first to exchange Sakazuki and tells him to form a new "Hyakki Yakou".He was on board of Takarabune and poured his medicine on Kubinashi and Itaku to stop their battle. Rikuo later punch him.

character.name: Kiyojuuji Kiyotsugu
character.description: Rich and influential amongst his class, he used to tease Rikuo about youkai until he was saved by "Night" Rikuo years ago. He now has an obsession with youkai, even to the point of wanting to be kidnapped. He is constantly inventing new youkai-related games and quizzes and has a very forceful personality.

character.name: Gyuuki
character.description: The kanji for his name means `bull.` According to legend, he was once a human who died searching for his mother. His resentment led him to become a youkai after his death. He is a high-ranked subordinate of the Nura group. He was in charge of a conspiracy against Rikuo using Kyuuso. It was revealed this coup was a means of a test, to see if Rikuo could handle being what he was and told Rikuo to abandon his human side as that would only get him killed. In response to Rikuo`s aim for being the third he works even harder now.He fought the Tengu of Mount Kurama 400 years ago. He appeared in Kyoto by the order of Nurarihyon to help Rikuo.

character.name: Kubinashi
character.description: A "No-neck" Youkai and one of Rikuo`s demon guardians. He fights using thread that entangle you the more you struggle, made from Kejourou`s personality and Jorougumo`s restriants. Part of Rikuo`s new "Hyakki Yakou" he is traveling to Kyoto. He used to go by the name `Joushuu No Gentsatsushi Kubinashi` (Lit. String Assassin of Hitachi Province) and is strong enough to restrain Toono youkai easily using his "Black string" technique. He seems to be a gizoku (honorable thief) before he joined the Nura clan. He goes back to his murderous way in Kyoto and is confronted by Ibaraki Douji. He was almost killed by Ibaraki Douji until he was saved by Kappa and Yura.

character.name: Aotabou
character.description: The degenerate priest who wears the iron blue robe and the physically strongest Youkai in the Nura household. He used to be a monk who killed many warriors. He has fists that can crush rock and palms that can fit a person`s head. He was enlightened by a holy man. He wishes to protect children after being enlightened. The holy man once stated that it is up to him whether to become human again or a raging god, he almost became human but he killed the people who were torturing the children he wishes to protect while crying. He is often seen with Kurotabou and the two are known as the assault officers of the Nura House. He has a skull necklace that when removed greatly increases his strength. He is also the leader of a biker gang called the Blood Night Hyakki Yakou. Part of Rikuo`s new "Hyakki Yakou" he is in Kyoto along with Yuki Onna. He fought and managed to kill Shoukera.

character.name: Kurata
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch19466 [Aotabou], in his human form. He`s following http://anidb.net/ch15458 [Rikuo] along with http://anidb.net/ch17494 [Tsurara], making sure he`s safe all the time.

character.name: Kurotabou
character.description: The Assassin and Destruction Monk & Master of the hidden blade, he is often seen with Aotabou and the two are known as the assault officers of the Nura House. In his human form he dresses like a businessman, and he also saved Torii from her curse as repayment for helping him. Part of Rikuo`s new "Hyakki Yakou", he is traveling to Kyoto. He is currently fighting Ibaraki Douji with Ryuuji and Mamiru.

character.name: Karasu Tengu
character.description: A "Crow-Tengu" Youkai he is the adviser to Nurarihyon and Messenger, he loyally follows the Nura clan. He has two sons and one daughter, the Sanbagarasu.

character.name: Kappa
character.description: A Kappa Youkai in the Nura clan whose domain is the fear of water and one of Rikuo`s demon guardians, he loves cucumbers. He fights extremely well near water and fights in a ninja suit. As part of Rikuo`s new "Hyakki Yakou", he is traveling to Kyoto. He appears to save Kubinashi and Kejourou.

character.name: Kejourou
character.description: A demon who uses her hair to fight, she serves as one of Rikuo`s Guardians. After Rikuo got beat at the first seal in Kyoto and went to recover and train she got the Hyakki Yako to keep motivated by asking them if they want to disappoint Rikuo when he got back. She appears to be Kubinashi`s lover, of sorts, having, in the past, offered her life to save his. She is also closest to Kubinashi out of all the Youkai in the series ad is once known as Kino. Her fear is Midaregami.

character.name: Keikain Yura
character.description: An Onmyouji of the Keikan House who specialises in shikigami, she can manage four at once impressing even Nurarihyon. She was trained by Akifusa and raised to see Youkai as evil, seeks to complete her training by defeating Nurarihyon and then inheriting the Household. After her brother reveals Rikuo as a Youkai and as Nurarihyon`s grandson, she says she can accept it if it`s him. She has returned to Kyoto to deal with the Hagoromo-Gitsune and has currently retreated to the keikan main house.

character.name: Maki Saori
character.description: A classmate of Rikuo and close friend of Torii, she stayed with her in the hospital until she woke up.

character.name: Nura Wakana
character.description: Rikuo`s mother. Though she herself is human, she seems to have no problem living in a home full of youkai.

character.name: Torii Natsumi
character.description: A classmate of Rikuo, she is a member of the Investigation squad. She is cursed by Sodemogi and nearly dies until Senba is given power by Torii`s grandmother`s belief, saving her life.

character.name: Shima Jirou
character.description: Kiyo`s underling has been supporting Kiyo since they were kids. Also a classmate and member of Kiyo`s Squad.

character.name: Hebidayu
character.description: Hebidayu is a youkai who looks like a scaly humanoid with a snake`s head who can elongate his neck or turn into a large snake. Though he exchanged sakazuki with http://anidb.net/ch17495 [Zen], he claimed that he only followed Zen because he was the easiest ride to the top. After Zen met with http://anidb.net/ch15458 [Rikuo] and learned that the latter had no intention of succeeding http://anidb.net/ch17493 [Nurarihyon]`s position, Hebidayu turned against him. Along with several like-minded subordinates, he burned down the Zen Sect`s house and tried to kill Zen, but was defeated and sliced in half by http://anidb.net/ch17492 ["Night" Rikuo].

character.name: Mokugyo Daruma
character.description: Leader of Nura clan`s Daruma alliance. He fought Shoukera 400 years ago.

character.name: Asajigahara no Kijo
character.description: Asajigahara no Kijo are the eaders of Kijo clan, made of a couple of an old hag and a little girl.

character.name: Nattou-Kozou
character.description: One of the demons who lives in Nura`s house. His head is a nattou and he consequently smells like nattou.

character.name: Ryouta-Neko
character.description: Head of the Bakeneko clan and leader of 1st street, he requested that Rikuo free the 1st street from the Kyuuso clan. He later reappears at the youkai party for Kana and is a known gambler.

character.name: Kyuuso
character.description: Kyuuso is the head of the http://anidb.net/ch37613 [Kyuuso Clan] and self-proclaimed "emperor of the night". He is an anthropomorphic rat youkai who first appears as a light-haired playboy going by the name Seiya. He runs a host club, Club Chu, near the east entrance of Ukiyoe Town`s shopping district. He calls http://anidb.net/ch19463 [Gyuuki] "boss" and acts like a cheerful playboy to attract women to the club - where he and his underlings literally devour them in the basement. In reality, he is a cruel and cold-hearted rat who takes advantage of people`s weaknesses. He is able to summon rats to do his bidding, and seems to hate rejection. Kyuuso kidnaps http://anidb.net/ch19473 [Yura] and http://anidb.net/ch15459 [Kana] to use as bait in luring out http://anidb.net/ch15458 [Rikuo], and declares that his clan intends to take over as leaders of the http://anidb.net/ch37514 [Nura Clan]. He orders Rikuo to send out a decree to all the Nura Clan leaders stating that he retracts his claim to be the Third, threatening to kill Yura and Kana if Rikuo doesn`t comply. When http://anidb.net/ch17492 ["Night" Rikuo] and the Hyakki Yakou of the main house thwart his plans, Kyuuso changes into http://anidb.net/ch37682 [a large grotesque rat] and tries to kill Rikuo. However, he is burned to death by "Night" Rikuo`s "Ougi Meikyou Shisui, Sakura" technique. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Mezumaru
character.description: Gyuuki clan`s young head assistant. Wears a horse`s skull and his face looks like a girl. Can control human with string but don`t have any other mean to attack so he usually become a support. Now lives in Nura`s house.

character.name: Gozumaru
character.description: Gyuuki clan`s young head. Cool and cruel, wield a katana, Tsume, he also able to control human with string but not as good Mezumaru. Now he lives in Nura`s house as candidate for next Gyuuki clan`s next leader, but actually a hostage.

character.name: Kuroumaru
character.description: The messy-haired tengu with a gem on his forehead.

character.name: Tosakamaru
character.description: The blond tengu with a mohawk.

character.name: Sasami
character.description: The long-haired tengu who wears glasses and the only female of the Sanbagarasu (as revealed in an omake in volume 6). She was disgusted by Mezumaru attacking the women`s baths. She wields a pair of short whips as weapons.

character.name: Hitotsume Nyudou
character.description: Leader of One-eyed demon clan. One of those who rejected Rikuo as the third Supreme Commander of the Nura clan. 400 years ago he was really different as he stated to Kokehime after being saved from Hagoromo-Gitsune, "Even if her tear become pearls, the one that fits her best is her smile", speaks volume of how different he was in the past.

character.name: Hihi
character.description: Former leader of Kantou great ape alliance (Hihi clan). Wears miko suit and a noh mask. Killed by Muchi. He has been with Ayakashi for 400 year before he was killed he told his son that he would choose for himself whether he would follow the Rikuo.

character.name: Ungaikyou
character.description: Ungaikyou, also known as the Purple Mirror, is a youkai that resembles a huge flaming skull attached to a tiny lion-like body. It rides a bicycle and is able to travel via mirrors, trapping its victims in the same manner. If you look into its mirror, you will be killed on your thirteenth birthday. http://anidb.net/ch15459 [Kana] first encountered it when she was 6 years old, when she and some other children found and looked into a purple mirror. The rest of the children turned up missing (and eventually dead) after they started middle school. It reappears on Kana`s 13th birthday with the intent to kill her but is stopped by http://anidb.net/ch17492 ["Night" Rikuo]. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Inugami
character.description: One of the seven heads of the 88 kiyakou. A human turned Inugami who serves Tamazuki faithfully. He was bullied relentlessly by a group of humans led by Tamazuki and killed them releasing his power. He hates and envies Rikuo for having both Human and youkai allies. He can transform into a large dog or separate his head from his body. He is killed by Tamazuki after failing to kill Rikuo. A stray dog appears at the end of the Arc that may be his reincarnation.

character.name: Inugamigyoubu Tamazuki
character.description: Leader of the 88 kiyakou of the four kingdoms, his father is the head of the 808 (Shikoku Hachijuukakki Yakou) Tanuki. He is able to inspire his men through his charisma but sees them as disposable, he sees through Rikuo`s power and seeks to return the world to darkness, even inviting Rikuo to join his group behind him in order to do so. He gained his power by killing his allies and brothers using the Maou`s Hammer, the very sword that defeated his clan. He was defeated by Rikuo and spared on his father`s wishes on the condition he never leave Shikoku and he holds a memorial for those he killed.

character.name: Muchi
character.description: A demon from Shikoku that manipulates the wind like a whip to cut enemies or make them fall ill. He targeted Nurarihyon but was defeated and disappeared into the wind.

character.name: Saburou-neko
character.description: Saburou-neko is an employee at Bakenekoya who was attacked by http://anidb.net/ch21908 [Muchi].

character.name: Shouei
character.description: The son of Hihi, his father was murdered by the Shikoku demons, he`s larger than most other demons in the group. He is strong enough to stop a charging Takarabune with the help of Reira freezing the ground.

character.name: Te-arai Oni
character.description: One of the seven heads of the 88 kiyakou. An Oni who is so large it`s said he straddles the gaps between mountains, he is the strongest of the group but loses to Aotabou after he removes his necklace.

character.name: Inuhouou
character.description: One of the seven heads of the 88 kiyakou, a bird youkai who breathes fire. Tamazuki used him as a shield from one of Rikuo`s attacks.

character.name: Yosuzume
character.description: One of the seven heads of the 88 kiyakou. A youkai whose black feathers make whoever they touch go temporarily blind, her "Genyakou" (Lit: Phantom Night Parade). She faces Yuki Onna but is defeated. She later takes the Maou`s Hammer from Tamazuki and returns it to Mitsume Yazura of the Nura clan, who started this incident.

character.name: Gangi Kouzou
character.description: One of the seven heads of the 88 kiyakou, he is a reptile-like yokai found near riverbanks. He has zig-zag teeth which he uses to eat fish and animals. At the 88 kiyakou`s headquarters, he guarded the entrance to a restricted area before encountering the undercover Gozumaru and Mezumaru. Using their string-manipulation skills, they used him to gain access to important areas of the headquarters, as well as to attack his fellows - which resulted in breaking his teeth. He fought Kappa in the battle against Rikuo`s Hyakki Yakou.

character.name: Hari-onna
character.description: One of the seven heads of the 88 kiyakou, she is a yokai who can turn her hair into hooks. She fought Kubinashi in the battle against Rikuo`s Hyakki Yakou and was later killed by Tamazuki.

character.name: Sodemogi-sama
character.description: One of the seven heads of the 88 kiyakou. A youkai who kills other Land gods who can`t fight back and turns their beliefs into his fear. Legend says that if you receive a tug on your sleeve and turn to see no one there, it is Sodemogi-sama who will when curse you. He seems to enjoy devouring articles of clothing from others. He curses Torii eating away at her life force and as a result is killed by Kurotabou.

character.name: Senba
character.description: One of the land gods. Have the power to heal disease if someone offers a thousand crane origami to his shrine. Because of years being neglected, he has become small and weak. But because of Hibari`s faith, he`s able to heal Torii Natsumi from Sodemogi`s curse.

character.name: Koke-hime
character.description: Koke-hime is one of the land gods. She wears a Heian-style kimono and usually stays in her shrine. Koke-hime was almost cursed by http://anidb.net/ch23226 [Sodemogi] but saved by http://anidb.net/ch19468 [Kurotabou]. 400 years ago, Kokehime was a human, but because of her power that made her tears into pearls, she was targeted by Hagoromo Gitsune. After being saved by the http://anidb.net/ch37514 [Nura Clan], she moved to Edo. She was shown to be attached to http://anidb.net/ch20583 [Hitotsume Nyudou] after the defeat of Hagorome Gitsune 400 years ago. Afterwards she was worshiped by the people and became a land god. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Shichinin Dougyou
character.description: The Seven Phantom Travelers are a group of Shikoku youkai who appear as travelers wearing conical straw hats. Normally they can`t be seen by the human eye unless one peeks through a gap like a crow`s crotch. They make up the executives of the demons of Shikoku and encountering them is said to bring misfortune.

character.name: Gagoze
character.description: Head of Gagoze alliance. He was known as a youkai that kidnapped and ate children. Many believed that he would be next in line to be the master of all spirits and was surprised when Rikuo was put forth as a candidate instead. After a failed plan to kill the potential third, he is killed by Night Rikuo.

character.name: Setsura
character.description: Another yuki-onna who was part of Nurarihyon`s Hyakki Yakou 400 years ago. Her solution to things she didn`t like was to freeze them. She is Tsurara`s mother and had an unrequited love for Nurarihyon, which resulted in her greatly disliking his eventual wife, Youhime. At the final battle with Hagoromo-Gitsune, she had a death match with Ibaraki-douji.

character.name: Nura-gumi
character.description: The Nura Clan is the biggest youkai faction in eastern Japan, they were first formed during the Sengoku Era and currently rule over the Kantou area. They are a yakuza youkai group with Nurarihyon as their leader and use the character for fear (畏) as their symbol. There are about ten thousand youkai who are considered members of the Nura group, divided into about 70 sub-clans. The group itself has been said to be in decline since the death of the second head, Rihan Nura. The Nura Clan main house is located in Ukiyoe Town. Source: http://nurarihyonnomago.wikia.com

character.name: Oumukade
character.description: Oumukade is a Nura Clan board member and the chairman of the Centipede Tribe. Source: http://nurarihyonnomago.wikia.com

character.name: Sorobanbou
character.description: Sorobanbou is a Nura Clan board member and the chairman of the Youkai Merchant Confederation. Source: http://nurarihyonnomago.wikia.com

character.name: Mottainai Obake
character.description: Mottainai Obake is a http://anidb.net/ch37514 [Nura Clan] board member and the chairman of the Obake Clan. Source: Nurarihyon no Mago Wiki

character.name: Mitsume Yazura
character.description: Mitsume Yazura is a member of the http://anidb.net/ch37514 [Nura Clan] and chairman of the Three-Eyed Party. Source: Nurarihyon no Mago Wiki

character.name: Kiyojuuji Kaiki Tanteidan
character.description: The Kiyojuuji Paranormal Investigation Squad is a group of students formed by Kiyotsugu to investigate youkai. Source: nurarihyonnomago.wikia.com

character.name: Tanrou
character.description: Tanrou is a Honshuu Wolf shikigami used by Yura Keikain. He has green eyes and is frequently used as a means of transportation by his owner. He is named for the star Dubhe of the constellation Ursa Major, which was called "Tanrou" in scriptures from China`s Tang Dynasty. Source: nurarihyonnomago.wikia.com

character.name: Keikain-ke
character.description: The Keikain House is a premiere onmyouji house from Kyoto that exorcise youkai for a living.

character.name: Kyuuso-gumi
character.description: The Kyuuso Clan is a clan composed of rat youkai, many of which disguise themselves as humans to lure in unsuspecting prey. They have a rivalry with the http://anidb.net/ch37615 [Bakeneko Clan]. They were once a part of the http://anidb.net/ch37514 [Nura Clan] but were excommunicated by http://anidb.net/ch17493 [Nurarihyon]. Source: Nurarihyon no Mago Wiki

character.name: Bakeneko-gumi
character.description: The Bakeneko Clan is a clan of anthropomorphic cat youkai who were originally put in charge of Ukiyoe Town`s First District but were later usurped by the http://anidb.net/ch37613 [Kyuuso Clan]. They are a group that has existed for a long time and had built up evil deeds as gamblers before being taken under the http://anidb.net/ch37514 [Nura Clan]`s wing. Under their clan`s control, the First District thrived as a place for youkai entertainment - their speciality being gambling. Despite this, the clan seeks to govern their territory with dignity so as not to disgrace the Nura Clan. After regaining control of the First District, they open a Japanese-style youkai eatery called Bakenekoya. Source: Nurarihyon no Mago Wiki

character.name: Tsukai Nezumi
character.description: The Errand Rat Youkai is a small anthropomorphic rat youkai who wears a kimono. He is a member of the http://anidb.net/ch37613 [Kyuuso Clan] and told http://anidb.net/ch15458 [Rikuo] he witnessed http://anidb.net/ch15459 [Kana] and http://anidb.net/ch19473 [Yura] being kidnapped. Source: Nurarihyon no Mago Wiki

character.name: Sanba Garasu
character.description: The Sanba Garasu are three tengu youkai siblings, whose father is http://anidb.net/ch19470 [Karasu Tengu].

character.name: Gyuuki-gumi
character.description: The Gyuuki Clan`s mansion sits atop Mount Nejireme, which forms the western boundary of the Nura Clan`s territory. They are said to manipulate, bewilder and draw in humans in order to kill them, and their clan emblem is the character for "Dread." Four hundred years ago, the Gyuuki Clan was one of the strongest warrior factions, and fought against the Nura Clan of the time. Source: nurarihyonnomago.wikia.com

character.name: Rokuson
character.description: Rokuson is a Sika Deer shikigami used by Yura Keikain. He has extraordinary jumping power and the kanji for his name written on either cheek. He is named for the star Phecda of the constellation Ursa Major, which was called "Rokuson" in scriptures from China`s Tang Dynasty. Source: nurarihyonnomago.wikia.com

character.name: Bukyoku
character.description: Bukyoku is an "ochimusha" (落武者, lit. "defeated samurai") shikigami used by http://anidb.net/ch19473 [Keikain Yura]. He is the only one shown capable of speech among her shikigami. Source: Nurarihyon no Mago Wiki

character.name: Takao-san Tengu Tou
character.description: The Mount Takao Tengu Party are a clan of tengu who are a part of the Nura Clan.

character.name: Umewakamaru
character.description: Umewakamaru is a human who was born into a house of nobles.

character.name: Hanako
character.description: Hanako was http://anidb.net/ch37641 [Yoshidano Shosho Korefusa]`s wife and http://anidb.net/ch37635 [Umewakamaru]`s mother.

character.name: Yoshidano Shosho Korefusa
character.description: Yoshidano Shosho Korefusa was a high-ranking noble and http://anidb.net/ch37635 [Umewakamaru]`s father.

character.name: Rentei
character.description: Rentei is a shikigami in the shape of a koi fish, used by http://anidb.net/ch19473 [Keikain Yura]. He is never used on his own, but rather merges with Yura to create a cannon attached to one arm. With this, Yura performs her Yomi Okuri, Yura MAX technique. He is named for the star Alioth of the constellation Ursa Major, which was called "Rentei" in scriptures from China`s Tang Dynasty. Source: Nurarihyon no Mago Wiki

character.name: Sannokuchi
character.description: Sannokuchi is a small youkai of the http://anidb.net/ch37514 [Nura Clan]. Because his mouth looks like the number "3," he is named as such. He is often seen in the company of http://anidb.net/ch20086 [Nattou Kozou], http://anidb.net/ch37686 [Toufu Kozou] and http://anidb.net/ch37687 [Ko-oni], and the group frequently play Go or hold miniature banquets.

character.name: Shikoku Hachijuuhakki Yakou
character.description: The Shikoku Hachijuuhakki Yakou or 88 Demons of Shikoku is an organization of yakuza youkai in Shikoku composed of 88 groups which was first built more than three hundred years ago by Inugamigyoubu Danuki. After being defeated by a force of humans while trying to overtake Matsuyama Castle, the group fell into decline. It was rebuilt by Inugamigyoubu Danuki`s son Tamazuki, who sought to take over the Nura Clan`s base of operations and, eventually, the world.

character.name: Hihi-gumi
character.description: The Hihi Clan, or Kantou Great Ape Alliance, consists of a large assortment of apelike youkai. They are a part of the Nura Clan. Due to the high standing of its former leader Hihi, the clan has a great amount of respect and power.

character.name: Toufu Kozou
character.description: Toufu Kozou is a youkai of the Nura Clan who is frequently seen together with Nattou Kozou, Sannokuchi and Ko-oni. He often played with Rikuo when the latter was a child. His appearance resembles that of a one-eyed goblin.

character.name: Ko-oni
character.description: Ko-oni is a small youkai of the Nura Clan who is often seen in the company of Nattou Kozou, Toufu Kozou and Sannokuchi. About 400 years ago, his hair was black but it has since gone gray except for the top of his head, which is bald. He likes sake and used to play tag with Rikuo when the latter was a child.

episode.title: 魑魅魍魎の主となれ
Becoming the Lord of Pandemonium
Le maître des monstres des montagnes et des rivières
Chimimouryou no Nushi to Nare
牛鬼様謀反, 顛末
Lord Gyuki`s Rebellion: The Whole Story
Retour sur la révolte de Gyûki
Gyuuki-sama Muhon, Tenmatsu
先陣の風, 西の方より
The Vanguard Wind Blows from the West
L’avant-garde amenée par le vent d’ouest
Senjin no Kaze, Nishi no Hou yori
魔鏡来りて果実を喰らう
Eating the Fruit from Beyond the Evil Mirror
Où le miroir maléfique vient cueillir un fruit
Makyou Kurite Kajitsu o Kurau
牛鬼の愛した奴良組
Gyuki`s Beloved Nura Clan
L`amour de Gyûki pour le clan Nura
Gyuuki no Aishita Nura-gumi
新月の夜に闇が動いた
Darkness Moves on the Night of the New Moon
Nouvelle lune, ténèbres vacillantes
Shingetsu no Yoru ni Yami ga Ugoita
魔の山に仕組まれし罠
A Trap Is Set on the Evil Mountain
Piège sur la montagne maléfique
Ma no Yama ni Shikumareshi Wana
鬼棲む山に紅き梅は咲く
Red Plum Blossoms on the Demons` Mountain
Fleurs rouges de pruniers sur la montagne du démon
Oni sumu Yama ni Akaki Ume wa Saku
闇の鼠は猫を喰らう
The Rat of Darkness Devours the Cat
Les Rats de la nuit dévorent les chats
Yami no Nezumi wa Neko o Kurau
花開院ゆらと清十字怪奇探偵団
Yura Keikain and the Kiyojuji Paranormal Patrol
Yura Keikain et les détectives mystères de Kiyojûji
Keikain Yura to Kiyojuuji Kaiki Tanteidan
毒羽根は竹林に舞う
Poison Wings Flutter in the Bamboo Thicket
Plumes empoisonnées dans les bambous
Doku Hane wa Chikurin ni Mau
隠神刑部狸玉章の手招き
The Inugamigyobu-Tanuki Tamazuki`s Beckoning
L`appel de Tamazuki Inugami-Gyôbu-Danuki
Inugamigyobu Tanuki Tamazusa no Temaneki
気高き魂, 紅に燃ゆ
The Sublime Spirit Burns Crimson
Une âme noble brûle avec éclat
Kedakaki Tamashii, Kurenai ni Moyu
凶犬, 廃墟に咆哮す
The Evil Dog Howls at the Ruins
Un chien féroce hurle dans les ruines
Kyou Inu, Haikyo ni Houkousu
幕は闇より開く
The Curtain Falls in the Darkness
Le rideau s’ouvre sur les ténèbres
Maku wa Yami Yori Hiraku
月は空にある
The Moon Is in the Sky
La Lune dans le ciel
Tsuki wa Sora ni Aru
少年たちの残照
The Afterglow of Youth
Deux garçons dans le soleil couchant
Shounen-tachi no Zanshou
